intro: Streptanthus obtusifolius, commonly known as the blunt-leafed broomrape, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species is characterized by its lack of chlorophyll and reliance on parasitic relationships with host plants for nutrients. Its flowers are typically small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. The plant is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
